intro: Uragoga leiocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, small, white fruits that mature in clusters. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Its leaves are compound, with a glossy surface, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Due to habitat loss, Uragoga leiocarpa is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
